text: Fresh flowers are delivered to the loading dock of an ups Chinese restaurant. Hands pick up a tub of long-stemmed, white flowers and ferry them through a kitchen where food preparation has begun. Vegetables are chopped. Woks are t down off hooks. Ducks get stuffed, etc. The hands move through swinging kitchen doors and into an elegant dining room. A slender vase sits in the middle of a plain white tablecloth. The hands insert three of the flowers in the vase, removing offending leaves and fluffing up the arrangement. The camera retreats to reveal a dining room of similarly accoutred tables and satisfied restaurant manager HUE LING. HUE returns through the kitchen doors and picks up a tray pre-cut fortune cookie dough. He holds the tray over his as he, again, navigates the kitchen. He sets it down in f of a frazzled twenty-something-year-old non-Asian, GARRET HENRY.
No more fortunes with the word "suckle" in them.
What?
A customer last night brought me his wife's fortune and it had the word "suckle" in it.
Do you remember how it was used?
I don't care how it was used! No more suckle.
It's another word for nourish, you know.
Then use "nourish," just no more suckle, «Suckling, «may one day suckle.
Bisuckle? MR. HUE wags a warning finger at GARRETT who takes a blac felt tip pen and adds the word suckle to a list that incl the words "dictator," "sponge," and "yankee."  Fortune Cookie - 2.

Casually-dressed TRENT KENNEDY enters his living room carrying mail. The home avoids usual bachelor trappings. There are no Ferrari Poster or dishes piled in sink, etc. entire wall is lined with full bookshelves, but miscellan books are strewn about as well. TRENT pushes play on his answering machine. He enters his kitchen and approaches a crib. We can't see who/what he's talking to.
Hey little guy. Still illin'?

Hey Trent. This is Teresa. God, this is embarrassing, but I think I left a pair of earrings over there last weekend. Anyway, they sort of go with what I'm wearing tonight, and I was wondering if maybe--if you're not going to be there-- if you could leave them out in your mailbox. I can just run by and pick them up later. ..0r whatever. TRENT walks back into his bedroom and pulls out the drawe his night stand. He opens a cigar box revealing condoms, dozen earrings, and a couple watches.
Shit. TRENT rifles through the box while a second message plays
This is Kevin--Kevin from the Black Hearted Irish. I was wondering if you were going to play that single I sent you on your show anytime soon? Give me a call. The third message is again TERESA.
They're green. And dangly. Relieved, TRENT pulls the correct pair of earrings out of box. He grabs an envelope off his desk and seals the earr inside.  Fortune Cookie - 3.

Seventeen-year-old HEATH PATTERSON inserts a compact disk into a jambox. The Jackson Five's "I'll Be There" purrs o of the speakers. Arms outstretched, he performs a cornbal waltz towards his sister, twenty-three-year-old BETH PATTERSON. She laughs.
They won't really play this, will they?
I want to be prepared for anything. BETH grabs her brother's hands and places them on her hip Then she puts her hands on his shoulders. She leads them a slow dance shuffle.
So this is it? This is simple!
I'm leading.
So? I don't have a problem with that. She can lead.
She might expect you to. Here. I'm going to stop, and you take over. After an awkward moment, the two resume the dance.
This isn't too hard.
Remember, there is a beat. HEATH works to find the beat.
You may not realize this, but we kids today--what with the decline in family values and all--dance a bit closer than this.
We're doing what is commonly known among the female sex as type four dancing. (CONTINUED )
Fortune Cookie - 4.
Ah, type four. Maybe I should be taking notes.

Perhaps. Notice the signs. We could fit a third person between us. My hands rest lightly and significantly above your hip bone. I'm staring not at you, but at the cute basketball player across the dance floor.
And type four dancing represents?
Utter disinterest.
Show me type three. BETH moves in closer to her brother.
OK, type three. Friendlier. Room to chat without bumping noses, but the invisible wall is still there. She's reserving judgement, but you've got her attention.
I'd take type three.
Who is this girl anyway?
A sublime beauty. A goddess. Poetry in a supermodel's body. Her name's Doug.
That's poetic.
Ann Douglas, but everyone calls her Doug.
And I assume she's been making a fool of herself pursuing you.
It's been embarrassing, really. The two dance for a moment in silence. (CONTINUED )
Fortune Cookie - 5.
The truth is, I'm not sure she knew my name before I asked her out. She's in my trig class.
Pretty gutsy.
Show me type two. BETH closes in on HEATH, eliminating the gap between them
(feigning disgust) Your things--they're touching me. Hey! Hey! Hey! Watch the hands, sister!
(ignoring him) Here's where you'll want to slide your hands down to the middle of her back. Unless they're sweaty. If they're sweaty, put ‘em on her hips ..on her jeans where she won't notice.
Is this where the sweet nothings come in?
Whoa, Tiger. We don't even have the training wheels off yet. So what made this girl say yes if she didn't know who you were?
Boatloads of charm. Plus, and probably more importantly, she just gut publicly dumped by a jock of some renown
And like a circling buzzard, my brother...
.Swooped down on the carcass.
A class act. The pair type-two dances for a few more seconds. (CONTINUED )
Fortune Cookie - 6.
Okay, this is starting to creep me out. I think I've got it. They separate and plop down in chairs.
Well let's hope she doesn't expect to be dipped.
Let's hope. So what are your plans for this glorious Friday night? You think they might tie up all the loose ends on The X Files.
Uh, I have a date.
Our long national nightmare is over. Who is he?
His name is Trent. He works at that radio station you and all your little skinhead buddies listen to.
If you insist on labeling us--we're "alternative." Oh wait a minute. I don't believe it. My sister has a date with Trent "The Dead" Kennedy.
I do?
I think Mom and Dad should know about this.
He seemed nice.
How'd you meet him?
He's in my book club.
The Ala-Geek-win Round Table. Well, he can read. We can put that in the plus (MORE ) (CONTINUED )
3 Fortune Cookie - 7.
HEATH (cont'd) column. You suppose once you marry him I can get free concert tickets?
It's just dinner.
Maybe a bumper sticker?
It probably won't amount to anything.
(baiting his sister) He's no Daniel, hunh?
Lay off, Heath.
Well, I'm sorry, but as cool as Daniel was, the dude's gone. He made his decision. I say it's time to get over it.
If I ever see Daniel again, I'll tell him it's over between the two of you.

A line of expensive looking cars wait in a circular drive next to a gymnasium. CAROLYN DOUGLAS, sitting behind the steering wheel of the one clunker in the row, reads Fortu Magazine as she waits for her daughter DOUG. A group of p pom carrying girls approach the cars. They tell each othe goodbye or, alternately, "see you tonight." DOUG gets in clunker.
Still engrossed in the article, CAROLYN absently starts t engine.
How was practice?
It was there.
Mmm hmm (CONTINUED )
Fortune Cookie - 8.
We were making one of those giant pyramids today. And you know James, that dwarf we just added to the squad? The one they experiment on in biology lab? Well he was the top of the pyramid.
(absently) Yeah?

Yeah? Anyway, I was supposed to be spotting, but I realized that I hadn't painted my nails, so I wandered over to my purse to get the polish--I saw no option--and then I heard this thud followed by all these manic cheerleaders screaming.
(still engrossed in magazine) Uh huh...

I ran back to where I was supposed to be standing, and there was James laying ina pool of blood, staring up, his eyes still open. He looked like that picture in our history book of Robert Kennedy after he had been assassinated. DOUG poses briefly like Robert Kennedy on the floor of th Ambassador Hotel. CAROLYN starts the car, and begins to p out of the lot.
Blockbuster stock is up again.
No kidding.
They're the fastest growing franchise in America.
The car pulls carefully out of the lot into light suburba traffic. (CONTINUED )
Fortune Cookie - 9.
(between resignation and anger) Wow. A moment of silence as the car continues down the street.
You don't suppose James' family is going to sue us?
Blood from a stone, Mom. Blood from a stone.
Nervous forty-year-old DEAN JEFFRIES stares at engagement rings through a glass case. A humorless and matronly SALE CLERK waddles over.
Is there anything you'd like to take a closer look at sir?
Uh, that one. The SALES CLERK withdraws the ring from the case and hand to DEAN. DEAN examines the dangling price tag. A look of concern passes across his face.
Three months salary is the rule of thumb sir.
What?
For how much you should spend, that is.
Who do you suppose came up with that rule?
Sir?
Well--and this is only a theory--but I suspect that whoever decided that three month's salary was the rule was sitting on your side of the counter. (CONTINUED )
7 Fortune Cookie - 10.
I wouldn't know. DEAN holds the ring up and admires it. He wants to get it
I think they were in cahoots with whoever invented Secretaries Day.
No, those were the flower shop people. We had nothing to do with that. DEAN laughs. The SALES CLERK still refuses to smile.
I have a question. The SALES CLERK stares at DEAN who remains uncomfortable.
Can you return them?
Within seventy two hours.
Um.. Do you.. I mean... Is there...
No questions asked, sir.
Do people laugh? Point and stare?
Not until you've left the premises. DEAN continues to study the ring.
I'll take it.
Will that be cash or credit?
I'll be using my first born.
I'll find a fancy box.  Fortune Cookie - 11.
Camera reveals an expansive and pristine Blockbuster Vide outlet, then pans to its neighbor, the nookish "Les Video
CAROLYN stands behind the counter while DOUG shelves vide in the tiny store.
The Unbearable Lightness of Being. It was about Czechoslovakia, but it was made in England.
True.
Thanks, but where does it go.
In the Daniel Day Lewis section.

Oh. You realize this is the reason that in the history of civilization no one has ever been able to find a movie at a video store without asking. I think we should start a trend. Let's just alphabetize every last one of them. No more subdividing by category, by country, by star, by director. Every movie in it's place.

Most people don't come in looking for a particular film. Most come in and browse. They like all the comedies being together. They like all the subtitled films together. There's an article in Video Entrepreneur that explains the strategy if you want to read about it.
(sarcastically) The new issue of Video Entrepreneur came in and you didn't tell me?
I was saving it for a special occasion. Your birthday isn't far off. (CONTINUED )
Fortune Cookie - 12.
Mom, why don't you just sell Blockbuster this space, marry Dean, and live happily ever after.
Don't you dare mention the M word in front of Dean.
You've been going out, what, a year?
To the day.
Well I want to know what his intentions are. He's a great guy. You're crazy about him. I'm tired of you two having to sneak around behind my back. I don't see what the hold up is here.
Honey, there are things you don't know about Dean.
He's a vampire, a bloodsucking prince of darkness. I had a feeling he was too good to be true.
And that's not even that bad part, honey. The thing is.. The thing is..
The thing is...
The thing is that it's none of your business, but just know that Dean is understandably a little gun-shy when it comes to marriage.
And how do you feel about it?
I can think of worse things, but I'm not going to let Dean know that. I'm sure it would scare him to death. (CONTINUED )
Fortune Cookie - 13.
Are you doing something with him tonight?
Yes, and speaking of which, don't you have a dance to start getting ready for?
Don't remind me.
Not looking forward to it?
I think I'm going to call him and tell him I can't go. Help me think of something. Hey, you said you wanted to start staying open late. Let's start tonight. I'll work.
You don't like this boy you're going with?

I don't know him. I don't know why he asked me. I was just too shocked to think of anything to say except yes. God, everybody in school knows I'm single, and Troy's already asked a freshman--A FRESHMAN--to the dance. Most of the time, if I have a clue somebody likes me who I don't want to go out with, I can manage to avoid being alone with him, or I'll already have an excuse--a good one-- just right there, ready, you know. At the tip of my tongue. This guy tricked me. He gave none of the usual preliminary signs.
The usual signs?
Stuttering. Shortness of breath. Describing his car stereo.
Is he cute?
That's the thing: I've never noticed. (CONTINUED )
Fortune Cookie - 14.
I don't think you can back out on a date to a formal dance four hours beforehand. He's probably already rented a tux.
Probably white. Probably with tails and a top hat. A pink cummerbund.
You know we used to think of dating as a chance to get to know people.
You and Betty and Wilma?
You know I met your father on a blind date.
That settles it. I'm staying home.
I think you should go.
I'll make you a deal.
I'm listening.
I'll go, but you've got to promise to snatch that corsage out of his hand right off. Otherwise I'll end up bleeding and felt up before I'm even out of the house.
And you promise not to run up and hug Dean and call him Daddy?
You gotta learn to take a joke, Mom.
All six primary characters and GARRETT will be interviewe their own environments. During Garrett's interview, restaurant employees continue to clean, vacuum, etc. behi him. (CONTINUED )
10 11 12 13 Fortune Cookie - 15.

The notice in the English grad student lounge said "Creative Writers Needed Bad," and of course, someone had added "Competent Grammarian Needed Worser" below that. When I saw it, I couldn't figure out what a Chinese Restaurant would need a "creative writer" for, but I needed a job. Mr. Hue told me the concept. He wanted someone who would write fortunes. You know..for the fortune cookies. No two, he said, could ever be the same. He didn't want any that said, "Confucious say, yadda yadda." He didn't want them pulled out of quotation books. And they had to be handwritten. He told me to give him one on the spot. I said, "Nine dollars an hour is a small price to pay for piece of mind." So I got the job. I try to be philosophical about it. I figure in the literary hierarchy, what I do comes somewhere between being the lyricist for Bryan Adams and writing street signs. Some of those street signs are brilliant by the way. I saw one once that said, "Men Laying Pipe Beware." I would have signed my name to that one.

TRENT sits in front of his high tech stereo system. He ha several CDs laid out in front of him: Van Morrison, Terre Trent D'arby, Elvis Costello, Bob Marley, etc. He humms " in the mood for love" as he refers to the song listings o the CDs and programs in appropriate mood music. He adjust the volume to a level that's been marked on the amplifier he pushes the final two buttons on the CD player, he spea
Repeat. Infinity.
BETH opens her closet. All of her dresses are black. Without much thought she reaches for one of the garments lays it out across the bed.
HEATH is fully decked out in his tux. He gazes at the dig clock impatiently waiting for it to change.  14 15 16 Fortune Cookie - 16.
DOUG talks on the phone. She is still in her gym clothes. is upset.
I can't believe I'm hearing this. Remember, YOU thought we were getting "too serious." YOU thought we ought to see other people. Do the words "we can still be friends" sound familiar?
DEAN showers. We see only a silhouette, but we can hear t shower radio which is broadcasting an advertisement featu a bickering married couple, both with grating voices.
Didn't I tell you to fix the roof?
I told ya! I'm watching the game!
You lazy good-for-nothing..
Nag. Nag. Nag.
Sound familiar? Maybe it's time you... We see DEAN'S silhouetted head bang into the shower radio effectively turning it off.

CAROLYN finishes loading an automatic drip coffee maker, setting it for 5 a.m. When she's finished this, she scrat an item off of a "to-do" list on the counter. She pulls m out of the refrigerator, sniffs it, then dumps it out. Ag she crosses an item off her list. Referring to her list, goes to the bottom of a stairway and yells.
Ann, you need to get off the phone and start getting ready.
(frustrated) In a minute! (CONTINUED )
16 17 18 Fortune Cookie - 17.
CAROLYN crosses this chore off her list.

TRENT straightens up his house. The books that have been laying about the living room he returns to shelves. Then, thinking a bit about it, he pulls "The Color Purple" and collected poems of Yeats from the shelves. He inserts a bookmark in one and leaves it conspicuously out on the co table. The other he places spread eagle in another unavoidable location.
BETH is now outfitted in her modest black dress. She walk into the living room of her apartment where her roommate AMANDA sits watching The Love Boat.
That Gopher...
You know the plan?
Page you at eleven p.m.
Should I set an alarm?
No, but you should take a chill pill.
Let's see. Am I forgetting anything?
(facetiously) You think we should synchronize watches?
Oh yeah. When you go to the store, could you pick me up a pint of Ben & Jerry's?
Traditional cure-all for post date blues.
You got it.  19 20 21 22 23 Fortune Cookie - 18.

HEATH continues to stare at the clock. As it turns 7:45, gets up deliberately, picks up the corsage sitting on his desk, takes one last look at himself in the mirror, and marches out of the house and to his car.

HEATH sets the corsage on the passenger seat, puts the ke the ignition and turns it. Nothing happens. He stares blankly. Then he calmly removes the keys, opens the small blade on his Swiss Army Knife and pretends to perform Har Kara.
DOUG is still in her gym clothes and on the telephone. Sh upset but has mellowed a bit.

«I've missed you too. ..Yeah. ..Yeah. I know what you mean. ..Have you told your new little friend? After tonight? You want to get back together AFTER the dance? ..Well which is worse, telling her before the dance or after? God, Troy, you want your cake and you want to eat it too. ..Yeah, but if you ate it, you wouldn't have it any more. Forget it, Troy, it's an expression. Just a second, I've got a calling coming in. DOUG clicks over to the second call.
Hello?
HEATH scrubs grease off his hands. He's got the cordless phone propped up next to his ear.
Uh, Doug. This is Heath.I'm sorry I'm running late. I'm have had some minor car problems here, but it's about taken care of.
DOUG finally looks at the clock. She had almost succeeded forgetting her own date. She is speechless.  24 25 26 27 Fortune Cookie - 19.
Uh, Doug? Uh, I'm sorry, is Doug there?
DOUG stares at a picture of herself with a boy we assume Troy.
This is Doug. Okay. That's no problem, Heath. In fact, I've been having some problems with my dress, so, uh, take your time. ..Okay. ..See you then. DOUG clicks back over to Troy.
Hey Troy? Look. I'll just see you at the dance. Maybe you'll get to meet my date. Bye.
CAROLYN rolls on deodorant. She scratches an item off her list. She applies lipstick and once again scratches an it off. She refers to the list.
(reading) Shower. She looks up disgustedly at her reflection and shakes her head.
DEAN works on getting his tie right. The TV in his room i tuned into the news.
The latest allegations levied by Prince Charles against Lady Di involve rumors of... DEAN uses the remote control to switch to a sports channe
The football team may be leaving Cleveland, but the city is keeping its name. (CONTINUED )
27 28 Fortune Cookie - 20.
DEAN flips channels again.

We return to Dean Martin and Jerry Lewis in... Flipping once more, DEAN lands on the Discovery channel. Onscreen, two amoeba's split apart. He turns the TV off, exits the room, working on his tie as he departs. He retu to the room a minute after the door closes and retrieves ring he has left on the bureau.
DOUG is frantically putting on makeup. CAROLYN is blow dr her hair.
Honey, will your generation of women ever appreciate what mine has done for you.
You heard from Blockbuster again?
"Mrs. Douglas, we have the utmost respect for you, Les Video and your clientele. You've really taught us a thing or two about persistence."
What's wrong with that?
What do you mean, what's wrong with it? It's patronizing. Persistence is just another way of saying I'm stubborn.
Sounds fine to me. Where's Dean taking you tonight?
That Chinese place, the one with the fortune cookies. Well there's more. They've upped the offer another five percent.
Those bastards. The Empire? (CONTINUED )
Fortune Cookie - 21. 28

The offer part's fine. It's this next line. "We would also accept you into our advanced management training program." Then they say something about where they'd transfer me and how much money I'd make when I got out. The Empire sounds right.
Wow, fancy. How much would they pay you?

That's not the point. I've been managing a store for ten years. What do I need to go to Blockbuster management school for? Are they going to teach me how to make an eye-catching display using eighty copies of Tango & Cash? Noticing DOUG'S transformation... CAROLYN (cont'd) You certainly are dressed to kill. I thought you weren't interested in this boy.
It's not for him.
TRENT sits in the DJ booth at an alternative rock station Something grungy buzzes out of the earphones hanging arou his neck.

There was this time--I think I was 16-- that I got asked to one of those Sadie Hawkins dances by this girl I didn't really know, but I said yes because, you know, I didn't want to be a dick. Technically, the girl is supposed to pick you up, but she didn't have a car and she lived like a thousand miles outside of town, so I drove out to get her. The first thing I do when I get there is lock my keys in the car. As if that's not enough, the motor's running, her parents have left for the evening, and my Dad's not home, so we're just stuck there. At first it's unbelievably awkward, but every time we look at the car we just (MORE ) (CONTINUED )
29 30 Fortune Cookie - 22.

TRENT (cont'd) bust out laughing. We end up going sledding on a big hill near her house which is a blast. You know how you have to hold on to each other, and we're screaming and laughing. We're out there living some sort of Norman Rockwell painting, and I'm thinking, "Gee, this girl is swell." Our fourth or fifth time down the hill, we slide into this huge pile of slush. When her parents get home, I'm standing in front of the fireplace in nothing but her Dad's bathrobe and a smile. But the Dad is cool. He's like, "Could I get you my slippers, Son?" I think that was the last time I had a good time on a date. Before it became a science. God, I can't even remember if I kissed her.
TRENT arrives at BETH'S door. Dressed sharply, he carries single rose. He knocks. BETH answers. AMANDA remains on t couch facing both the TV and the door.
Hi. You ready?
(concerned) I don't look ready?
No, I mean yeah, you look ready. It was rhetorical..sort of. I guess I meant are you available to leave?
A flying start.
Yeah, let's go.
(holding out rose) This is for you.
Thanks. BETH holds the flower self-consciously trying to decide whether she should carry it or leave it in a vase. TRENT notices. (CONTINUED )
30 3 Fortune Cookie - 23.
I got it from one of those sidewalk vendors. They say selling flowers keeps them off crack.
A single rose means I love you. BETH and TRENT, both horrified, turn and gape at AMANDA.
Thank you, Miss Manners.
Just thought you should know.
HEATH fidgets in the living room. CAROLYN puts on her own shoes as she tries to stall for her daughter.
Ann says the two of you have math together.
Trig--and boy does it come in handy. There's a pause while CAROLYN decides whether HEATH is be intentionally funny.
Ann says those college prep course are difficult.
Pretty tough. A moment of awkward silence.
So what are your plans?
Well, after graduation, I think I want to go to a four-year school, you know, study art, maybe go into animation.
Uh, I'll need Ann home before that. (CONTINUED )
31 Fortune Cookie - 24.

Sorry. You mean tonight. Dinner before the dance at Louie's On The Lake. A bunch of friends of mine are eating there. Then I was going to take her to this coffee shop down by the university. They've got one of my pieces on display there. I don't know. You think that would look like showing off?
I'm not sure what... CAROLYN stops speaking when she sees HEATH'S jaw drop. Be her DOUG has entered the room looking stunning. HEATH sta up. He's holding the corsage box in his trembling hand.
Would you like some help with that, Heath? HEATH hands the box off to CAROLYN without taking his eye off DOUG.
Hi, sorry I'm running late.
These aren't the socks I wanted to wear.
What?
Oh, what do you know? This is a wrist corsage. CAROLYN helps DOUG on with the corsage while HEATH fidget
Now, Ann, I want you home no later than... DOUG mouths the word "early" to her mother.
midnight.
Oh, mom.
Midnight, and I mean it. I need you to inventory the store in the morning. (CONTINUED )
Fortune Cookie - 25.
CAROLYN works the group towards the door.
Nice meeting you, Heath.
Thanks, you too.
I think she'd like to see your work.
See his what? CAROLYN closes the door on the couple.
As HEATH and DOUG stroll up the sidewalk, DEAN pulls up i front of the house.
Hey, Dean!
Hey, Kiddo. Bowling tonight?
Tractor pull. Unintroduced, HEATH stands uncomfortably.
Is your mom ready?
For a hostile takeover, yes. For a date? Who knows.
Actually, with our dates, it's tough to tell the difference.
(covering her ears) I don't want to hear about it. DOUG finally remembers HEATH.
Dean, this is Heath. (CONTINUED )
32 33 Fortune Cookie - 26.
Hi. None of the pretty girls willing to go with you? HEATH laughs nervously.
We have math together.
Trig.

Maybe you'll be able to get some homework done tonight. DEAN reaches out to shake Heath's hand. When he does, the ring box falls out of the jacket he's carrying. He stuffs back in his pocket quickly, but not before DOUG notices.
(upon box retrieval, shaking Heath's hand) Sorry about that. Never know when you're going to need that spare glass eye. Good to meet you.
Uh, yeah.
We better go. Mom gives him demerits for tardiness. See ya, Dean. DOUG leads HEATH away.
(calling after them) Have fun. DEAN knocks on the door while opening it up.
DEAN enters the house.

Hi, honey. I'm home. DEAN plops down on the couch and kicks his feet up on an ottoman. CAROLYN enters room with a cordless phone presse her ear. She nods at DEAN, but continues the conversation (CONTINUED )
Fortune Cookie - 27. 33
(angrily) No, you see, I wouldn't be calling you at home if you returned my calls from your shop which is where you should be anyway. You promised me those VCRs last week.
Big day at the office.
I rent them. You fix them. It works better that way.
Naw, you wouldn't want to hear about it.
Well where are the parts coming from? The eighteenth century? We have this thing now. It's called next-day delivery?
Okay, Okay. They want me to head up the new software division.
No they don't use ponies anymore.
And, from what I understand, San Francisco is a beautiful city.
Can I get that in blood?
Good weather. Fancy rice dishes.
Always a pleasure, Mr. Willis.
Great restaurants. CAROLYN clicks the phone off emphatically.
What about great restaurants?
We're going to one. You ready?  Fortune Cookie - 28.
TRENT and BETH drive to the restaurant.
It's called The Empire. Have you heard of it?
No.
I've just been a couple times. Food's great. Service is unbelievable. And they have this thing.
This thing?
This thing they do. They handwrite your fortunes in the fortune cookies. Last time I went the ink was still wet.
That's hygienic. Do you remember what it said?
Clearly. It said, "Risk your heart without fear. Loneness gone. Romance near."
And was it?
Real near. The guy one table over from me was performing a non-surgical tonsillectomy on his date.
God, I hate that.
Yeah.
It said "loneness"--not loneliness?
That's what made me remember it. (CONTINUED )
34 35 Fortune Cookie - 29.
I don't know if I like that. I mean, loneliness is bad--we can all agree on that--but I'm not sure "loneness" is.
It's like people think that if you're alone, you're automatically unhappy.
I'm very content by myself.
Same here.
DOUG and HEATH ride in Heath's car in uncomfortable silen
Hey, what do you think about eating at The Empire?
(hesitating) Sounds fine.
Did you already have plans?
No, not really. The pair returns to the uncomfortable silence.
Mr. Jeffries coached me in Little League.
Dean? He didn't remember you?
I was seven at the time. I think he might have if I would have sat next to him and yelled, "Hey batter, batter, batter, batter, swwwwwwing" Again with the silence.
Don't you hate Mrs. Shropshire? (CONTINUED )
Fortune Cookie - 30.
Yeah. You have her for government?
No.
Civics?
(uneasily) No.
